title: FPS DROPS!!! FROM 187 TO 36
body:
Hey, this new patch is out and my fps is normal about (187) when we start fighitng i experience a lags and my fps drops from 125 to 36 and its driving me crazy. 

Any ideas ?

replies.body:
Hey there!

Have you checked out the steps in the [Wrenchmen's Toolbox](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/peVhMJAo-the-wrenchmens-toolbox-common-solutions-to-your-problems-technical-issues) yet? If you have, could you attempt to delete your Game.cfg file? You can do this by following these steps:

- Navigate to Your Install Installation (Usually C:) > Riot Games > League of Legends > Config
- Locate the game.cfg file
- delete the game.cfg file
- relaunch League.


NOTE: This will reset your graphics settings. Please try this in a custom match to verify everything is functioning properly before playing a real match!

So just wanted to jump in here with the following steps I've taken to eliminate this problem since 4.1ish. It seems to be getting worse and worse as new patches/champs come out. The new SumRift map is virtually unplayable.

I've had 60-120fps since first season with all settings at max. Since around 4.1 it has been dropping in team fights, more so with specific champs: {{champion:112}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:161}}. The nexus/inhib blowing up also has a delay as well.

Nvidia EVGA GTX 285 2gb ddr 340.52
Core i7 920 2.67mhz
12GB ddr3 RAM @ 1600mhz
Win 7 x64

No reason this computer cant run league. So this is what I've done...

1. Defrag HD
2. Cleaned System registry w/ ccleaner
3. Antivirus scan = negative
4. Updated video drivers from Nvidia 
5. Changed Game.cfg file w/ following (yes I took out the double entries).
   [UnitRenderStyle]
    Inking=0
    AdvancedReflection=0
    PerPixelPointLighting=0
6. Deleted Game.cfg, Reinstalled League
7. Uninstalled League.
8. Fully resinstalled League.
9. Rolled back graphic driver 3x. 
10. Uninstalled Nvidia Card.
11. Reinstalled Nvidia Card.
12. Disabled Sound
13. All video settings to lowest setting with everything unchecked.
14. Disabled all non-essential services in windows.
15. Set all windows settings to "best performance" aka uncheck everything.
16. Used OpenHardware monitor to watch temps, GPU under 80c while Leaguing. 36% Ram in use.
17. Edited Registry to increase TdrDelay to 10sec.
18. Repaired League through ingame repair tool.
19. Reset Nvidia 3D settings to default.
20. Uninstalled Adobe Air, Reinstalled
21. Uninstalled DirectX, Reinstalled
22. Removed PandoMediaBooster.
23. Read through the R3D logs and cant find anything worth looking at.
24. Set League exe to high priorty. Closed everything else non system related.
25. Removed Grpahics Card from system. Cleaned throughly with Air. Cleaned PCI slot, reseated card.
26. Tested RAM with MemTest, no errors.
27. Replaced RAM with 8gb DDR3 @ 1600mhz, no difference.
28. Changed PCI slot for Nvidia Card. 
29. Updated BIOS.
30. Posted on League Forum Help & Support (here)

The updates that have been done to the graphics for better use on lower end cards is negatively impacting high end cards. No idea why. League is the only game I've had trouble with, and it has only been since 4.1. Judging by the amount of FPS lag posts in recent weeks, there's something very wrong with the graphics.

That's pretty strange actually, since you've got a pretty awesome setup. I recommend you actually [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) about this as we'll be able to work on this a little better on a one on one scenario!

187fps???
40 is normal for me. is there really any difference?
Up to about 60fps, yes. There's a difference. After that... not really. The monitor refresh rate is normally around 60-80 fps, so anything above that doesnt mean anything useful for playing.
